intro: Stemodia lanceolata f. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stemodia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves, which are broader than the typical variety of the species. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. This form is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking foliage and floral display.
